message: Can you believe it? That influencer photoshoot is blowing up! We're making waves all over social media.
dfs
Our watches and loafers are all over everyone's feeds
You're telling me? My inbox is packed with customer queries

Welcome to Discount Disaster the responsibility is on you to size up the problem.

? *Use `/help` at any time for a list of useful links and commands*
 ? *Use `/incident` to create an incident record*

Once you're ready just click start to begin
Yeah I'm seeing it traffic's surging. But nothing we didn't anticipate for
Good. We've optimised the backend for this kind of spike
Let's just make sure that's all it is - legit traffic. Influencer campaigns can attract more than just customers
I'll keep eyes on the dashboard. We're running at nearly 80% capacity right now for all the user actvity our platform can handle
It's all good. People are scrambling to get their hands on our products. That viral post is gold
We're inching closer to max capacity. We're at 95% load now
I just refreshed the website and it's now taking ages to load
Is the website down? Or maybe it's just my machine
@daniel can you also have a look with Shay
Sure
We see a lot of https429 errors
sdf
*Incident Number INC100082:* P1 website down
Not again - is this a global issue ?
Im seeing a lot of errors in the logs
Not sure what the root cause is but we are seeing high load on our Frontend Pods - this may be due to the ongoing discount or if it could be related to any tests we were running.
We are actively looking into it
I see high number of rest-call errors like  http429 http503 and 504s

```

:star: Form an effective investigation team
Seeing frontend errors as well
Thanks i have a stake holders meet in next 15  - Get me as many details as possible before that

```
[error] 12345#12345: *98765 limiting requests exceeded 10 requests per second for client 149.34.52.176 request: GET /api/GetInfo HTTP/1.1 FrontEndApp

``` ```

Do we know what the expected amount of traffic should be due to the on-going discount?
:bulb: Use metrics as evidence
okay folks all hands on deck lets first idenfity the service causing issues
:star: Take command
Checking now

this does look like a global issue
:star: Qualify the problem
let's look at the error logs to identify which service is failing

Front end App is unable to handle the load
:bulb: Check the changes done in the platform
@hamed can we add more capacity?
@Tanya ca we do that ?
@hamed @tanya please confirm if any changes made
:star: Check changes done to the platform
We have already max'ed out our capacity on addition
Do we know if this is not due to sale ?
@tanya @hamed let's confirm any changes first
:star: Reviewed changes
What % of new logins was expected due to sale ?
Thats' bad - Any ETA ?
https://uptime-labs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ULPUBLIC/pages/1118961668/Discount+Disaster+-+Change+Request+Logs
Changes this morning
I see few load tests running on our platform CHG85387
@tanya let's disable any load testing
Pausing all tests now
let's disable both CHG85389 and CHG85389
Yes i have paused all tests - i still see the errors
CHG85387 - ie

@Christene - Lets try to ground and see what all we know till now .
!. The login load has crossed 6k 
2. 1 suspect - Load test - its not
3. How about external load ?
Do the logs indicate any errors with a particular service or just failure to keep up with request load?
:star: Facts over opinion
We have paused all load tests  still the errors persists
Just failure to keep up load
Can you confirm what the load is now vs historical average max load?
:star: Asking questions to validate impact of the problem
The sale was expected to bring just 10% more sales - the number we see is not normal
It looks like the issue is related to added load on the system. Activey triaging now.
Historical avg load till date is 1.6k Logins per minutes right now its 6k
@Christene  Can we get the network distribution across regions data ?@Anyone
I have validated all changes - This is not due to changes- The load is external
great idea is the load being distributed across all available capacity?
I was looking at Network traffic - But the dashboard took ages to load.
Here's a screenshot of Network traffic across each region.
dfs
Wow Spain must really like our products
sdf
are we certain that this is not coming from a small set of IPs? @hamed
This looks suspicious to me @Christene
lets involve Sec ops

@Maya
@hamed yes please involve them
:star: Escalating when required
Hey @cflounders-bloomberg.net after reviewing the logs I strongly suspect that this is a security-related issue.
The abnormally high traffic with http 429 503 and 504 errors may be due to a possible DDoS/DoS attack
I'll need to continue investigating further but it definitely looks like something is targeting our system
@maya great thanks - can we please block the range of IPs we see this coming from
Looks like we have a security threat - We should be extra careful with this incident
Do we know what's the financial impact of the issue? How much are we losing every minute?
@cflounders-bloomberg.net Should we inform the 'Compliance Team' about this issue?
The Compliance Team makes sure we follow laws and rules like reporting the incident to the right people and keeping proper records. It helps us avoid legal trouble and protects our reputation.
@Christene  as you said looking at logs from dan - It is from single IP
we believe this is due to DDoS we are actively looking to migitae
https://comms.prod.uptimelabs.io/bloomberg-net/pl/bkhadu8qn3r9fqenpkmaugzoja\nFrom my logs earlier : client: 149.34.52.176
:star: Form a working theory
Okay since this is from Single IP- I will work on blocking it
Yes please involve compliance about reporting this as we believe it's due to a DDOos
@maya please let me know if you need any help
WHat are we doing to mitigate this ?
The IP address has now been blocked
Can you confirm @cflounders-bloomberg.net?
Lucky this was DoS (Denial of Service ) from a single IP - What if this attack happens from multiple IP addresses (DDoS)?
Thanks can everyone look at logs/and see if still an issue
:star: Cross checking resolution with team
We should start working on the pending WAF rule updates for the frontend
Can you please check how's the website doing now ?
@cflounders-bloomberg.net Should we let the customers know about the attack?
Leave Compliance with me - I will talk to them
@all please do not communicate anything we will need to make sure this communicated correctly due to regulatatory concerns
@all everyone it looks like this is currently fixed - can everyone confirm?
